No....kids don't need to have a cell phone in class. Who do you need to call anyway? Your friends are all at school too, for the most part, and why do you want to bug someone else while you are at school. Forgodsakes, leave people alone and quit calling them every two minutes.
zachvac

Of course I think cell phones should be turned off during the school day, I do think that they should be able to call during lunch, but I really don't care about that. The one time it matters is after-school activities and getting a ride. I live a good 45 minutes away from school and when traffic is bad it can be easily over an hour. I play baseball so we practice every day after school. If my parent is stuck in traffic they can leave a message saying "I'll probably be there at whatever time" and then I can go in and do homework until they get here.
 
 Currently our school policy is no phones during the school day, not even during lunch. Of course you can use the pay phones during lunch. I'm not sure but I wouldn't be surprised if some of that is because of money, but I really don't care because I don't see a need for cell phones during lunch anyway. If a cell phone goes off the teacher takes it and then the parent has to go in to get it back. The teacher tells the parent about the policy and that the kid's phone was on before giving it back.
 
 
 The one other problem with cell phones is there is a problem with text message cheating. I've never actually seen anyone do it and I would think it would be easy to catch but there was a recent newspaper article about it and they said it was a big problem.

wilted_laughter

Handphones? Cellphones? emoticon_frazzled They're called mobile phones people. :p 
 
 
 You can't make calls (other than pranks) in class. But can sure as hell send sms and mms. Or whatever else you might be able to do in terms of games, radio transmitter/receiver, internet and so forth.
 
 I remember my old school initially tried banning phones outright, if you were caught with your phone then it would get confiscated until you paid a fairly hefty fine. This wasn't really working so they introduced a "registration" in which you could register your phone, registered phones were OK to have on your person as long as they weren't on.
 
 This didn't really work either, as nobody bothered to register.
 
 EDIT: Ah I've just remembered that camera phones were banned outright. The teachers were worried about pictures being taken of them, if you catch my drift.
 
 People used their phones fairly freely in school, and during break in full view of the teachers. Lunch was a non-issue as everyone goes into town for lunch. No loser canteen food for us.
 
 It might have gotten stricter since though, they were getting pretty heavy on the discipline as I was leaving the school: IE cameras everywhere, ID cards for all students (that one has to swipe in the doors to get into school_ etc...
Phantos

I think they should not be allowed in the classroom. Outside of class, fine, if you're late for class you're responsible for what you've missed. However, in a lecture hall of 2-300 students, all taking a test, and one student forgets to turn off his phone and he gets a call it breaks everyone's concentration. It's also very disrespectful to a professor or a teacher to have a phone ring in the middle of his/her lecture. The easy solution is to just turn them all off, but there's always that one student who doesn't.
